citations.narrative:
- The guinea pig enclosure in the indoor area of the facility had no water present. When fresh water was offered, the
guinea pigs immediately started drinking and continued drinking for more than a minute. This clearly shows that the
guinea pigs were extremely thirsty and had been deprived of water for too long a period. Lack of water can have severe
impacts on the health and well being of animals. The facility must ensure that all guinea pigs are given drinking water as
often as necessary to meet their fluid requirements.
Licensee corrected by providing water on 21 August 2024

- In the indoor portion of the facility two rabbits had escaped their enclosure and were wandering in the open area of the
inner room. Animals that escape the safety of their enclosure are at risk of injury or illness. Enclosures must be of sturdy
construction, maintained in good repair, and must safely contain the animals. The facility must ensure that the rabbits can
be kept in their designated enclosure.
Correct from 21 August 2024 onward.

- The feed supply area had three bags of feed stored directly on the floor. The room contained numerous rodent
droppings near the stored feed. Improper storage of feed can result in contamination of the feed and subsequent negative
health impact on the animals. Feed and bedding supplies must be stored in a manner that protects against contamination.
All supplies should be kept off the ground and protected from rodents, insects, and any other form of contamination.
Correct by 21 August 2024 onward.

- The goats in the outdoor portion of the facility had no water at all and when offered water, immediately started drinking
and drank continuously for several minutes while inspectors observed them.
The chinchillas in the indoor area had no water available, and when offered water all animals drank immediately for
several minutes while inspectors observed them.
The reactions of these animals clearly show that they were suffering from a lack of water and had been deprived of
drinking water for too long a period of time. Lack of water can have a severe impact on the health of animals. The facility
must ensure that all animals have access to potable water as often as necessary to ensure their health and well being.
- The raccoons in the outdoor area of the facility had only their "swimming pool water" available, which was dirty and
contaminated with feces, bedding, feed, and other debris. There was no other water source available in the enclosure. A
raccoon was observed by the lead inspector drinking directly from the dirty pool water. Drinking non-potable water can
have a severe impact on the health and well being of the animals. The facility must ensure that all animals have access to
clean potable water as often as needed to support their needs.
Licensee corrected by providing water on 21 August 2024

- The parakeet enclosure in the inner area of the facility had no water present. When offered fresh water numerous birds
swarmed the water receptacle and aggressively consumed the water. The birds drank continuously for at least several
minutes while inspectors observed the animals. This clearly indicates that the parakeets were suffering from severe thirst
and had been deprived of water for too long a time. Birds must be offered potable water as often as necessary to ensure
their health and well-being. The facility must ensure that all birds receive water frequently enough to support their
hydration needs.
Licensee corrected by providing water on 21 August 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.30  Direct
   
Watering. 
- The guinea pig enclosure in the indoor area of the facility had no water present. When fresh water was offered, the 
guinea pigs immediately started drinking and continued drinking for more than a minute. This clearly shows that the

3.50(a)

- In the indoor portion of the facility two rabbits had escaped their enclosure and were wandering in the open area of the

3.125(c)

Correct by 21 August 2024 onward. 
3.130  Direct
   
Watering. 
- The goats in the outdoor portion of the facility had no water at all and when offered water, immediately started drinking 
and drank continuously for several minutes while inspectors observed them.

The chinchillas in the indoor area had no water available, and when offered water all animals drank immediately for

The reactions of these animals clearly show that they were suffering from a lack of water and had been deprived of 
drinking water for too long a period of time. Lack of water can have a severe impact on the health of animals. The facility 
must ensure that all animals have access to potable water as often as necessary to ensure their health and well being. 
 
- The raccoons in the outdoor area of the facility had only their "swimming pool water" available, which was dirty and 
contaminated with feces, bedding, feed, and other debris. There was no other water source available in the enclosure. A 
raccoon was observed by the lead inspector drinking directly from the dirty pool water. Drinking non-potable water can

3.156  Direct
   
Watering 
- The parakeet enclosure in the inner area of the facility had no water present. When offered fresh water numerous birds 
swarmed the water receptacle and aggressively consumed the water. The birds drank continuously for at least several 
minutes while inspectors observed the animals. This clearly indicates that the parakeets were suffering from severe thirst 
and had been deprived of water for too long a time. Birds must be offered potable water as often as necessary to ensure 
their health and well-being. The facility must ensure that all birds receive water frequently enough to support their 
hydration needs. 
Licensee corrected by providing water on 21 August 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
MICHAEL TYGART, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
